name: ZeroKit Node.js sample backend
description: A simple express app that serves as the backend of the ZeroKit example clients. You will need a free account from https://manage.tresorit.io

ZKIT_SERVICE_URL.description: The service url from the admin portal

ZKIT_ADMIN_KEY.description: The admin key from the admin portal

ZKIT_SDK_VERSION.description: The version of ZeroKit that the application uses

ZKIT_BASE_URL.description: The url where you will reach the backend (e.g. https://salty-headland-12345.herokuapp.com)

ZKIT_DB_URL.description: A url to a mongo db, by default it links to a mongodb on heroku, meaning your data is lost every restart

ZKIT_CODE_CLIENT_ID.description: The id of a web IDP client. You can add on on the management portal.

ZKIT_CODE_CLIENT_SECRET.description: The secret of a web IDP client. You can add on on the management portal.

ZKIT_HYBRID_CLIENT_ID.description: The id of an SDK IDP client. You can add on on the management portal.

ZKIT_HYBRID_CLIENT_SECRET.description: The secret of an SDK IDP client. You can add on on the management portal.

ZKIT_CONFIG_FILE.description: Relative path to the configuration file. To use these values it has to be "./config.env"
